etymology.description: Phonetic: 辟 (bì, "law") + Semantic: 肉 (ròu, "meat; flesh") -> represents part of the body made of flesh -> denotes an 'arm'
etymology.interpretation: The character 臂(bì, "arm") uses 辟(bì, "law") for its phonetic component and 肉(ròu, "meat; flesh") as the semantic element to indicate a part of the body that is fleshy, thus referring to an 'arm'.

examples.chinese: 他的臂很有力(他的臂很有力)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de bì hěn yǒu lì.

examples.chinese: 他挥动臂膀(他揮動臂膀)，显示出惊人的力量(顯示出驚人的力量)。
examples.pinyin: Tā huīdòng bìbǎng, xiǎnshì chū jīngrén de lìliàng.
examples.english: He swings his arms, showing his incredible strength.

examples.chinese: 在团队比赛中(在團隊比賽中)，他总是一臂当先(他總是一臂當先)。
examples.pinyin: Zài tuánduì bǐsài zhōng, tā zǒng shì yī bì dāngxiān.
examples.english: In the team competition, he always takes the lead.
